result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Gruenwald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 54 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
DNA costs and Blood draw costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Once Blood costs are paid will be forwarded to the City of Muskego Police Dept.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Not to enter any bar, tavern, pub, liquor store, or any place that primarliy sells alcohol.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Needs to attend Victim Impact Panel yet

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Gruenwald

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A Gruenwald in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files amended information.  State strikes the repeater enhancer.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court strikes the repeater.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:

3 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 54 days )
1 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
May not enter any bar, tavern, liquor store, or any place that primarily sells alcohol
FINE: $2277.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Surcharge: $250.0  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Sample ordered (if not previously taken) and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Muskego Police Department.
DL REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
